summary: Play as the Maormer in a lore friendly and balanced way.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#1155cc][size=6][b]Maormerious - Sea Elves of Skyrim[/b][/size][/color]


[b][size=3]Maormerious implements the Pyandonean Maormer as a playable race in a lore friendly way. Don't forget to endorse if you like it![/size]

[center]﻿[b][color=#000000][size=6]I have begun a mod that is going to add NPCs of my various races throughout Skyrim. [/size][size=6]If you would like to contribute to the project, either as a quest scripter, writer, or even a dungeon designer, send me a message!
[/size][/color]
[b][size=6][b]You can find updates on the Zebsirious NPC Expansion as well as any of my other projects [url=https://zebsimods.blogspot.com/]here[/url]﻿![/b][/size]
[/b]
[color=#000000][size=5]This mod is out of date. An updated version can be found [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88919]here[/url]﻿, as part of my Zebsirious race compilation.
[/size][/color][/b][/center][/b][color=#1155cc][size=5][b]Features[/b][/size][/color]

[list]
[*][size=3]A new playable race, the Maormer[/size]
[*][size=3]Imperious-style stats and abilities[/size]
[/list]
[size=4][b][color=#1155cc]Maormer skill bonuses[/color][/b]
[/size]
+10 Sneak
+10 One Handed
+5 Destruction
+5 Light Armor
+5 Alteration
+5 Conjuration

[size=4][b][color=#1155cc]Stats and abilities[/color][/b]

[/size]Health: 90
Magicka: 100
Stamina: 110
Health regeneration: 0.75%
Magicka regeneration: 3.25%
Stamina regeneration: 4.75%
Carry Weight: 300

[list]
[*][b]Colorless[/b]: Become partially invisible at will. Health, Magicka, and Stamina don't regenerate while the effect is active.
[*][b]Snake Charmer[/b]: You can tame giant snakes by defeating them.
[*][b]Water of Life[/b]: Rapidly regenerate Magicka and Stamina when low on health.
[/list]
[color=#1155cc]Quest reward - Perform 25 sneak attacks to unlock[/color]
[b]Tempest[/b]: [i]1/day [/i]- Summon a violent thunderstorm for 60 seconds. Shock spells cost 50% less during the storm.

[size=4][b][color=#1155cc]Snake Charming[/color][/b]

[/size]You can find 3 unique giant snakes throughout Skyrim. If you are a Maormer, killing a snake will "tame" it, giving you a power to summon the defeated snake for 60 seconds, once a day. Be sure to deliver the final blow, or you may not get the power.

[list]
[*][size=2][b]Raena[/b]: Weakest (80% of player level, min level 5) of the snakes, can be found behind the abandoned shack.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][b][size=2]Etoni[/size][/b][size=2]: Second strongest (Equal to player level, min level 10) of the snakes, can be found beneath the bridge to the College of Winterhold.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[/size][list]
[*][size=2][b]Telin[/b]: Strongest (120% of player level, min level 15) of the snakes, can be found on the small island behind Septimus Signus' Outpost.[/size]
[/list][size=2]
[color=#1155cc][size=4][b]Requirements[/b][/size][/color]

[list]
[*][size=2]Skyrim[/size]
[*][size=2]Update 1.9[/size]
[*][size=2]Dawnguard[/size]
[*][size=2]Dragonborn[/size]
[*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10165]RacialCompatibility.esm[/url]﻿[/size]
[*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24168/?]RaceCompatibility for Skyrim and Dawnguard[/url]﻿ (overwrite the files in RacialCompatibility with TMPhoenix's files)[/size]
[/list]
[/size][color=#1155cc][size=4][b]Compatibility[/b][/size][/color]

While not gamebreaking, using Etheral Elven Overhaul causes some clipping issues on Maormer with beards.

A bashed patch may be necessary for compatibility with mods that edit headparts formlists.

[size=4][b][color=#1155cc]Permissions[/color][/b]
[/size]
I used assets from other authors, so you must get their permission before using anything from this mod.

But as long as I am credited and notified, you may, without my permission:
[list]
[*][size=2]Upload translations of this mod[/size]
[*][size=2]Make compatibility patches for this mod[/size]
[*][size=2]Port this mod over to SSE[/size]
[/list]
If you'd like to use assets of this mod for any other reason, you must get my permission first. 

[b][color=#1155cc][size=4]Recommended[/size] [size=4]Mods[/size][/color][/b]

[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/87874]Dwemerious[/url] - My Imperious-esque Dwemer race mod
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88418]Falmerious[/url] - My Imperious-esque Snow Elf race mod
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29624/?]RaceMenu[/url] - Character Creation is just as important as racial stats and abilities.

[size=4][b][color=#1155cc]Credits[/color][/b]
[/size]EnaiSiaion for [size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61218]inspiration and a couple scripts
[/url][/size]Den987 for[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43401] Maormer[/url] [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32893/]bodies[/url]
expired6978 for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/10165]RacialCompatibility[/url]
TMPhoenix for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24168/?]RaceCompatibility for Skyrim and Dawnguard
[/url]MihailMods for [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88294]the snakes[/url]
author: Zebsi

files.name: Maormerious - Sea Elves Of Skyrim
files.changelogHtml:
Changed the way Colorless works to fix the issue with invisibility effects.
Fixed the percentages with Water of Life.
